alert.note: Alert for Cullman (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Cullman County through 830 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms producing intense rainfall, centered near Nesmith, or 10 miles west of Cullman, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches could fall within an hour or less. Ponding of water could create hazardous travel conditions. Locations impacted include... Cullman, Good Hope, Holly Pond, Dodge City, Baldwin, Vinemont, West Point, Phelan, Logan and Crane Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
